thread.title: More than 150 new emojis added in iOS update
thread.title_full: More than 150 new emojis added in iOS update

title: More than 150 new emojis added in iOS update
text:
More than 150 new emojis added in iOS update ALYSSA NEWCOMB 5:03 PM, Oct 22, 2015 3 hours ago Copyright 2015 Scripps Media, Inc. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. Show Caption Next 
At long last, the taco emoji is here. 
Apple's iOS 9.1 update released this week includes more than 150 new emoji characters, including the oft-requested taco, a champagne bottle with a popping cork, a unicorn and even a middle finger. 
While the Unicode Consortium, the group overseeing emoji standards across platforms, first showed off its latest line-up of new emoji earlier this year, it's up to each company to then include the new characters in future operating system updates. 
The new emoji are available for iPhone users with a software update. This is Apple's third iOS 9 update, following iOS 9.0.1 and iOS 9.0.2. 
The Unicode Consortium also shared a few new characters being considered for next year. Among them are bacon, a pregnant woman, a cowboy, a clown and a person taking a selfie. 
The group said it considers a variety of factors in choosing which emoji to add to its line-up, including the expected usage level, image distinctiveness and how often it is requested -- proving that persistent requests for the long elusive taco have paid off. Copyright 2015 ABC NEWS
